column4: and it freezes up each time it gets to "Preparing to replace mysql-server-5.1 5.1.41-3ubuntu12 (using .../mysql-server-5.1_5.1.41-3ubuntu12.1_amd64.deb) ..."
sudo dpkg --configure -a
[sudo] password for doneill:
dpkg: error processing mysql-server-5.1 (--configure):
Package is in a very bad inconsistent state - you should
reinstall it before attempting configuration.
Errors were encountered while processing:
yeah, i see that.  Sorry, this is my first time using IRC
when i do that, it tells me "E: could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11:Resource Temporarily unavailabe)
i had to "killall apt-get" earlier
you have any package managers open?
no
anything indicating dpkg or apt in a process list?
i don't think so.   i did a killall on apt-get earlier after it hung
is there something else it might be called?
affert... that might be the problem.  Hrm, not sure how to unlock it.  read the manpages on dpkg and see if there is an option to unlock the file
can i just delete the lock file to unlock?
when i run sudo apt-get update, it gets a bunch of files
then says "reading package lists... Done"
(BTW, how do I use paste.ubuntu.com? )
that means it's downloading an updated list of available packages and putting them into the database
